DOCNAME: CASE OF ZELENI BALKANI v. BULGARIA
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies) dismissed;Violation of Art. 11;Violation of Art. 11+13;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . On an unspecified date GPE ( the municipality ) started clearing the banks and the riverbed of the river “ GPE , which runs through the city . The procedure involved the uprooting and eradication of trees and plant life , which were blocking the flow of the river .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant organisation believed that the actions of the municipality were in violation of the domestic environmental protection legislation and that the disorderly uprooting and eradication of the trees and the plant life would disrupt the biological balance of the river .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant organisation informed the municipality of its intention to hold a public rally on DATE , DATE , in front of the municipality . The aim of the public rally was to protest against the municipality 's actions and to demand that the disorderly uprooting and eradication of the river 's plant life be stopped because it was destroying important alluvial trees and the habitat of rare , endangered birds .

CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE the municipality informed the applicant organisation that it would not permit the rally to go ahead as planned . The full text of the letter , signed by the secretary of the municipality , read as follows :
“ We inform you that GPE does not permit the conducting of the [ planned ] public rally . ”

CARDINAL . Later on DATE , police officers visited the offices of the applicant organisation and obtained signed declarations from its leaders that they were aware of the prohibition and would not organise the rally as planned .
CARDINAL . The applicant organisation did not hold a rally on DATE and the clearing the banks and the riverbed of the river “ NORP ” continued unabated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant organisation appealed against the municipality 's prohibition of its public rally . The appeal was filed with the municipality which did not forward it , as required under the applicable legislation , to the domestic courts together with all relevant documents .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant organisation re - filed its appeal with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG requested the municipality to provide it with its file and all other relevant documents regarding the public rally planned by the applicant organisation .
CARDINAL . The municipality sent the requested documents to ORG on DATE with the exception of the applicant organisation 's appeal of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG requested that the municipality also provide it with the applicant organisation 's appeal of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE it also instructed the applicant organisation to deposit the required court fee , which the latter did on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the municipality provided ORG with the applicant organisation 's appeal of DATE .
CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE the applicant organisation 's appeal was examined by ORG .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE ORG declared null and void the municipality 's prohibition of the public rally planned by the applicant organisation for DATE . It established that the prohibition had been issued in violation of the provisions of ORG , as it had been decided not by the mayor but by the secretary of the municipality . Furthermore , it lacked reference to any of the statutory grounds for issuing such prohibitions .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant organisation claimed , which the Government did not challenge , that it was informed of the judgment of ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . No appeal was filed against the judgment of DATE and it became final on an unspecified date .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW ( DATE ) and ORG ( DATE ) have been summarised in the ORG 's judgment in the case of ORG and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Section DATE ( CARDINAL ) of LAW provided at the relevant time that the administrative authority , whose act was being appealed , had an obligation to forward the appeal filed with it to the competent court within DATE together with its full file on the matter . The second paragraph of this section provided that if the appeal and file were not forwarded to the courts then the appellant had the right to re - file his appeal directly with the courts .

CARDINAL . NORP Before DATE ORG of DATE ( the “ ORG ” ) provided , inter alia , that the ORG was liable for damage caused only to private persons by ( a ) the illegal acts , actions or omissions of its bodies and officials acting within the scope of , or in connection with , their administrative duties ; and ( b ) the organs of the investigation , the prosecution and the courts ( sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL : see PERSON № DATE от CARDINAL г. по гр. д. № DATE г. , V г. о. на ORG and PERSON решение № CARDINAL от CARDINAL г. по т. гр. д. № CARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , ORG на ВКС ) .

CARDINAL . NORP Currently , the ORG and local municipalities are also liable for damage caused to juridical entities by the illegal acts , actions or omissions of their bodies and officials acting within the scope of , or in connection with , their administrative duties ( section CARDINAL ) . The amendment does not have retroactive effect in respect of damage cause prior to its date of introduction .
